comments.comment:
Exhausted by politics, beguiled by politicians over generations, we have now become a nation that is dreaming of being governed by a Dictator. It is as if a young woman, neglected by her parents, dreams of a marrying a strict abusive husband to discipline her. A dangerous self destroying dream, dreamt by those who‚Äôs confidence has crumbled.

Corrupt politicians have taken us to a place, where we no longer believe that we are deserving of just, honest, benevolent leaders. We are willing to accept those who pocket 50% as long as they ‚Äòdo something‚Äô from the balance 50%, even if they are murderers, or those who have stolen billions in public funds.  

The belief that we are a nation of uncivilized, undisciplined, lazy, foolish citizens, who can only be corrected and made productive by a Dictator, has been driven into our consciousness to keep us enslaved by those who seek to consolidate their dominance and positions of power. 

As long as the Dictator does not impact our life directly, looking at that dream is extremely tempting. Like watchng a Hindi movie, where the villain is executed with much glee and applause, absent any inquiry or involvement of a justice system. Like the shanties that we loath to see in a town, disappearing overnight. Our ‚Äòthirst for justice‚Äô is quenched. 

Yet one day, when the Dictator takes control of the justice system, the media, and begins to diminish your rights as a citizen, throw away your rights as a human, you will realize that its not much ‚Äúfun‚Äù having a Dictator. 

*This letter is for the consideration of those dreaming of a Dictatorial President.*


*‡∂Ø‡∑ñ‡∑Ç‡∂´‡∂∫‡∂ß ‡∑Ä‡∑í‡∂ª‡∑î‡∂Ø‡∑ä‡∂∞ ‡∂¢‡∂±‡∂≠‡∑è‡∑Ä | ‡Æä‡Æ¥‡Æ≤‡ØÅ‡Æï‡Øç‡Æï‡ØÅ ‡Æé‡Æ§‡Æø‡Æ∞‡Ææ‡Æ© ‡ÆÆ‡Æï‡Øç‡Æï‡Æ≥‡Øç | People Against Corruption*
ANewHopeForSL@gmail.com

comments.comment: I don't know what to comment. But I am happy at least that someone who has the will power to fight against the corrupted judicial system of Sri Lanka. We citizens have enough evidence to prove that the law and order of our country hold by a team of people. Some cases I myself feel to go for international courts. Because, being a citizen of Sri Lanka, I know very well that we cannot rely on the juridical system of our country. The judges as well the lawyers  are not reliable. If either lawyer or a Judge says that they are genuine, please call for a public debate. Then everybody could understand what is the truth and their experience of the dirty and corrupted judicial system of our country. Belive me, I hate this system. Our judicial system something like a public toilet that neglected cleaning and maintenance.
comments.author: Chandra Surasena
